Description: This workshop will provide attendees with new analytic tools and conceptual insights about the use of population descriptors such as race, ethnicity, and ancestry in cancer research. Through interactive discussions and presentations, attendees will gain a deeper understanding of the nuanced differences among these descriptors, as well as the implications of their use in research and clinical genetics. As new ways of conceptualizing population diversity emerge, attendees will develop an intuition about how to revise existing protocols and adopt more precise and informative frameworks in their own research studies moving forward.
SearchResultBody: MW007. Methods and Implications for Race- and Ancestry-based Population Descriptors in Cancer Research
Title: Methods and Implications for Race- and Ancestry-based Population Descriptors in Cancer Research
